title: As a user I want to create a new Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN a club or BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating Grandfathered Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the International in the left nav
custom_expected:
On the International tab there is a "New Player" form available, per the wireframe.
The "Next" button is disabled until all of the required fields have been entered.
The National ID fields are conditionally required based on the selection of "Birth Country", and this should be reflected via the red asterisks displayed on the UI.
Entering the required fields on the Create New form, including a DOB before 9/1/1995 will take the user to a new grandfathered profile, per the data discovery and wireframe. (the far right column describes Grandfathered profiles)
Any action buttons and calculated fields (Eligible to Sign date/Meets Age Requirements) are handled in follow up stories.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered_-_hidden_profile

title: As a user I want to save a new Grandfathered profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or club user is logged in with edit Grandfathered profile permissions
AND User has navigated to the International Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a new Grandfathered profile in edit mode
custom_expected:
THEN there is a "Save" button available as well as a "Cancel" button.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to cancel. If they confirm, the user is returned to the point of entry and no profile is stored. If they do not confirm, they are returned to the profile in edit mode. 
OR If the user clicks "Save", then the system runs a required field and formatting check per the provided data discovery, saves the profile and throws a blue successful save notification. 

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered_-_hidden_profile

title: As a user I want to see an error if I attempt to change a grandfathered player's DOB to that of a player subject to registration
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC and Club user logs with edit permission for Grandfathered profile
AND user opens an existing Grandfathered profile in edit mode
custom_steps: WHEN user changes a grandfathered player's date of birth to a date equal to or after 9/1/1995
custom_expected:
THEN system will throw a hard error. 
AND Message #15 should display on save.
"You cannot save a grandfathered player with a birth date after 9/1/1995."

Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347695

Messages #15: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787668/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to see an error if I am entering a new grandfathered player profile that matches another profile (4 of 6)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating Grandfathered Profile
AND user is  entering a new grandfathered player profile that matches another profile (4 of 6)
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "Next" on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN the system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND For grandfathered players, this is a 4 of 6 check instead of 4 of 7 because we do not allow them to enter Player IDs for grandfathered players as a criteria. 
AND If a match is found, the user gets a hard error.
"You cannot create a profile for this player because one already exists" (See Messages #7)
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is run on "Save" when the profile is being edited. 

*Because there are no visibility rules around grandfathered players - this works the same for all users*

Business Rules:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787792/4+of+7+Check

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches-_grandfathered

Messages #7: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787668/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want to see an error if I am entering a new grandfathered player profile that has the same national ID as another player
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a club and BOC user is logged in with permissions for creating Grandfathered Profile
AND user is entering a new grandfathered player profile that has the same national ID as another player
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "Next" on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN the system will run a duplicate profile check according to the provided rules (National ID Only for this story). 
AND If a National ID is entered, the system should check to see if any other International Amateur profile already exists with the same National ID and Country.  
AND If another international amateur profile is found with the same National ID and National ID country, the user gets a hard error. See Messages #7
-- "You cannot create a profile for this player because one already exists." --
AND If no match is found, the user is able to proceed with profile creation. 

*Because there are no visibility rules around grandfathered players - this works the same for all users*

Business Rules:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787792/4+of+7+Check

Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches-_grandfathered

Messages #7: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787668/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to delete a grandfathered player profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC logs in with Grandfathered profile delete permissions
AND User has navigated to the International Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user opens a Grandfathered profile in edit or view mode
custom_expected:
THEN There is a "delete" button when viewing a grandfathered player profile in edit mode or view mode.
AND Clicking "Delete" prompts the user to confirm they wish to delete the profile. 
See Messages #10 -- "You are attempting to delete this player from the system. All of the player's information will be lost and cannot be recovered. Would you like to continue? "-- Yes- Continues with deletion process No - Cancels deletion and returns user to player's profile
AND clicking YES on that message will prompt the user to confirm deletion. 
See Messages # 11. -- Deleting this profile will PERMANENTLY remove the player from the system.--
AND If the user confirms both messages, the player is deleted from the system. They should no longer appear on any widgets, searches and reports.

Messages: 
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787668/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a user I want the system to determine whether the player I'm creating a profile for is subject to registration
custom_preconds:
GIVEN BOC or Club user is logged in with Create Permissions for Registration Profile
AND user is navigate to the International Dashboard
custom_steps: WHEN user clicking "New Player"
custom_expected:
THEN the system will load the "Create New" form where the user can begin the process of creating a new International Amateur profile.
AND This form matches the provided wireframe.
AND Entering a date of birth with prompt the system to determine if the player the user is creating a profile for is subject to registration or not (using the provided rules). 
AND If the player is subject to registration, then the note "Subject to L1 Reg" appears next to the DOB field. The "Next" button will also be replaced with a "Register" button.  
OR If the player is not subject to registration, then the note "Not Subject to L1 Reg" appears next to the DOB fields. The "Next" button remains a "Next" button. 
AND Any time the user changes the DOB on the form, the system will need to re-check the profile type and make the appropriate updates.
AND Selecting a "Country of Residence" will pre-populate the Birth Country field with the same value. 
AND The Birth Country will remain editable, and updating the Birth Country field will NOT change the Country of Residence.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=grandfathered
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=registration

Rules:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787793/Registration+Requirement

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to edit the First Review for a Registration Profile
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a BOC user logged in with permission to edit International Amateur Registration Profile 
AND user navigated to the Registration Profile
custom_steps: WHEN user click the edit button on the Registration Profile
custom_expected:
THEN the system will reload the Registration profile in edit mode. This will include the "Registration Reviews" section - which does not display in View mode until a value is set for the First Review. (Any other section is outside the scope of this story and may or may not be editable at this time). 
AND If none of the Registration Reviews have ever been edited, then only the First Review field is displayed, and it is blank. 
AND The user is able to set the First Review to any of the available statuses, per the data discovery, including the display of the comments section where relevant. 
AND On Save, the system will store the selected review status. 
AND If "Pre-Verified" was selected as the status, Club users continue to see whatever the prior status was, according to the rules. 
OR If Pre-Verified" or "Verified" is selected as the status, when the user next loads the profile, this field is locked and uneditable.
OR If any other status is selected as the status, when the user next loads the profile, this field remains open and editable - and the Second Review field is NOT available.

Data Discovery: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=89347752

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=master (scroll down to edit mode)

Rules:
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/EBIS/pages/3787790/Registration+Statuses

*Note that the rule that prevents users from verifying during certain points of the year is NOT included in this. This story assumes it is always available.*

title: As a user I want to see National ID required if a player's Birth Country requires it
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user navigates to International tab
custom_steps: WHEN entering a player info on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN The system will prepopulated the National ID country based on the country selected for the Country of Residence (just like Birth Country). 
AND The "National ID Type" field is ONLY displayed if there is more than one type available (currently only true for US and its territories). 
AND If the National ID has a validation check, the required format is displayed as help text in the National ID field. 
AND If the National ID has a validation check and a national ID is entered, hitting "Next" or "Register" from the Create New will verify that the National ID entered matches the required format. 
AND If the National ID is required based on the entered BIRTH country a red * will be visible.
AND If the National ID is required based on the entered BIRTH country, and no National ID value is entered, then hitting "Register" or "Next" will trigger a required field error. 
AND The National ID fields will prepopulate on the profile whatever was entered on the Create New. 
AND The same validation and required field checks run on the Create New will also be run anytime the profile is Saved. 
AND If there is no National ID required and one is NOT entered, then in view mode - no National ID fields will display. (even though National ID country is selected).
AND If a national ID has been entered, it displays in view mode like it does now for Pro Player Profiles, with the Country subheading and using the "Display" value from the Country Listing document. (see comment for example)
* This story is also to serve as a general cleanup of how the Country fields work. What is contained in the provided documentation is 100% correct for National ID Information and for the third sub-level Sector information. Any other discrepancies, please discuss with me (Camille) prior to implementing changes. The intent is that at the end of this the documentation and system are 100% in sync!


Acceptance Criteria: 
*Note that some of the validation checks here ARE different from what is in the DB so this will need to be reviewed and is intentional*

*All of the above are applicable regardless of who is entering the profile, and for both registration and grandfathered players*

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to Select a player for L2 Registration
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_l2_registration_listing_-_boc
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=select_popup
Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+Selection
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user has navigated to the L2 Possibility widget and is viewing it for current signing period
custom_expected:
THEN user should see a "Select" button for any player on the L2 Possibility widget that has a completed L1 Registration profile that has a current Registration Status of "Verified"
AND the "Select" button should not be available for prior years
AND clicking "Select" should open a pop up, per the provided wireframe 
AND "BOC (All)" should be checked by default
AND when BOC is checked, the Select2 should be blanked out and disabled
AND when BOC is unchecked, the Select2 should be available and it should be a multi-select2 that allows the user to pick one or more of the 30 Clubs
AND when either "BOC" is checked OR at least one Org has been added, the "Confirm" button should enable
AND clicking the "Cancel" button should close the pop up and no changes should be made to the player
AND clicking "Confirm" should select the player for L2 Registration by the entered Organization(s)
AND the pop up should close, and the selection should display in the L2 Possibilities widget
AND the "Level 2 Registered" field on the player's profile should read "Selected" for all users if the player was selected by BOC
AND the "Level 2 Registered" field on the player's profile should read "Selected" ONLY for the BOC and the Selecting Org if the player was not selected by the BOC. It should continue to read "No" for all other Orgs
AND the player should be available in the BOC's Level 2 Registered widget
AND the player should be available in all Club's Level 2 Registered widget if the player was selected by the BOC
AND the player should be available only in the BOC and the selecting Org's widget if the player was selected by an Org other than the BOC
AND the "Select" button should still be available for the Player in the L2 Possibilities widget. Clicking on this again should open the same popup with whatever was selected the first time displayed. The user should have the opportunity to change or add Orgs using the pop up

custom_steps:

custom_expected:
BOC users should have the ability to uncheck the L2 Possibility checkbox UNLESS the player has already been selected for L2 Registration.

title: As an LRD user I want to receive a "daily digest" email of L2 Drug Test Results requested
custom_preconds: GIVEN LRD user is on the Email Utility to receive a "daily digest" email of L2 Drug Test Results requested
custom_steps: WHEN Club user requests L2 Drug Test Results for a player
custom_expected:
THEN At the end of each day, the system should check to see if any new L2 Drug Test Results requests were entered that day.
AND If no, then no email is generated.
OR If yes, then an email should be generated to those users that are in the Utility under "L2 Drug Test Results" as meant to receive the email.
AND The email should have the subject "mm/dd/yyyy L2 Drug Test Results Requests"
AND The email body should contain a "NEW REQUESTS:" header followed by a bulleted list of all of the requests entered into the system for the day, regardless of current status. The list should be formatted as Requesting Org - First AND Middle Last Extended Last. Ex: ARI - John David Jones Smith
AND Sort of the bulleted list should be on ORG and then on Player name.

title: As a BOC user I want to be able to Elevate a player to L2 Registered
custom_preconds:
Wireframe:
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_l2_registration_listing_-_boc
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=elevate_popup=
Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Level+2+Elevation
GIVEN a BOC user is logged in with Intl Ama Reg Admin permissions
AND one or more players that have been selected by an org are displayed in the L2 Possibilities widget
custom_steps: WHEN user navigates to the L2 Possibilities Widget
custom_expected:
THEN user should see an "Elevate" button for any player on the L2 Possibility widget that has been Selected by any Org(including BOC)
AND clicking "Elevate" should open a pop up, per the provided wireframe 
AND when a date has been added, the "Elevate" button should enable
AND clicking the "Cancel" button should close the pop up and no changes should be made to the player
AND clicking "Elevate" should set the Level 2 Registered date for the player to the date entered in the pop up
AND the pop up should close 
AND if the player was Selected by the BOC, once the player has been Elevated, they should no longer appear in the L2 Possibilities widget
AND if the player was Selected by a Club, the player should continue to appear in the L2 Possibilities widget, and the BOC should continue to be able to add ORGs to their Selection 
AND the "Level 2 Registered" field on the player's profile should read the entered date for all users if the player was selected by BOC
AND the "Level 2 Registered" field on the player's profile should read the entered date ONLY for the BOC and the Selecting Org if the player was not selected by the BOC. It should continue to read "No" for all other Orgs
AND these visibility restrictions should also apply to advanced search
AND the player should be available in the BOC's Level 2 Registered widget with the new elevation date
AND the player should be available in all Clubs' Level 2 Registered widget if the player was selected by the BOC
AND the player should be available only in the BOC and the selecting Org's widget if the player was selected by an Org other than the BOC
AND BOC users should be able to edit the L2 Date on the player profile after elevation. Club users should never have that ability

AND The attached files selected as "Master" will display under the MASTER origin for BOC users. 
AND The contact information selected as "Master" will display under the MASTER origin for BOC users. 
AND Any Origins that were available on BOTH profiles are also available to the BOC under the "Origin" dropdown.  (Ex: If Player 1 had Origins of BOC and MLSB, and Player 2 had Origins of BOC and BOS, the profile after the merge will have Master, BOC - 1, BOC- 2, MLSB and BOS)

AND Clubs continue to see ONLY their own Contact information and Attached Files.

title: As a user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches an Unregistered profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club and BOC user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN user user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND If a match is found to an international player profile that has a Registration Status of "Unregistered", then the user gets a warning. See Messages #5.
AND This check is also run on "Save" when the profile is being created for the first time.
AND This check is conditionally run on "Save" for subsequent saves. That workflow is covered in #155273711.
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND The "Register MLSB Entered" button should only be enabled if the information that matches the MLSB Unregistered Profile is selected in the modal. 
AND Clicking "Register MLSB Entered" should navigate the user to the Unregistered MLSB entered profile. (Actual registration covered in a separate story). 
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again. 

*Note for QA - in the past we've seen behavior where if the user clicks "Cancel" goes back and makes edits (or doesn't) and clicks "Register" again the matching logic isn't kicked off again so make sure to test for this case*

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=possible_matches_-_mlsb_unregistered

AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again.

title: As a Club user I do NOT want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches a profile I do not have permission to see
custom_preconds: GIVEN Club user logs in with International Amateur registration permission
custom_steps: WHEN club user clicks on 'Register' on the Create New
custom_expected:
THEN system will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules. 
AND Club users will only see a match per stories if they have permission to view the matching profile as a match. 
AND Club users are able to see a profile as a match under the following conditions: 
  - The player has been selected for L2 Registration by the BOC.
  - The player has been entered by the viewing Org.
  - The player has been added to the viewing Org's Club Reg List. 
  - The player has passed their Eligible to Sign Date. 
  - The player has been identified as a Group 1 or Group 2 player from their MLSB Reports. (flag on profile)
  - The player has been explicitly been made public by the BOC by a flag on their profile. 
BUT If none of the above conditions have been met - then the player may appear as a match only under the following conditions: 
        - The player has been registered and their First Review has been set to "Verified" or "Pre-Verified". 
        - The player is Unregistered and does not have a Scouting Status of "International Suspect".

Business Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Visibility Rules: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+-+Profile+Visibility

title: As a BOC user I want to see a warning if I am entering a new registration player profile that matches another profile

GIVEN BOC user is logged in with Create permissions for Registration Profile 
AND user navigates to International tab 
AND user is entering info that matches existing profile in the create new Registration Profile form
custom_steps: WHEN user click on "Register" on the Create New will run a duplicate check according to the provided rules
custom_expected:
THEN If a match is found to another international player profile, then the user gets a warning. See Messages #4 or 5. This should work the same as for Club users, except there are no visibility restrictions for the BOC, so they will see matches to any matching profile in the system. 
AND The "Register" button should only be enabled if the information that the Club is currently entering is selected in the modal. This is the default selection. 
AND Clicking "Register" will proceed with profile creation. 
AND Any matches to the entered information that belong to a profile that the Club registered or are already on the Club's Registration List are displayed as matches, but the radio buttons are greyed out or simply not displayed. 
AND If any of the profile matches are Unregistered, there should be a "Register MLSB Entered" button available on the modal. If that profile is selected, the button should be enabled. Clicking the button should navigate the user to the Unregistered profile. 
AND If any of the profile matches are Registered, but not yet on the BOC's Club Registration list, there should be an "Add to Club Reg List" button available on the modal. If that profile is selected, the button should be enabled. 
AND Clicking the button should navigate the user to the relevant profile. 
AND The "Cancel" button should always be enabled, regardless of which profile is selected. 
AND Clicking "Cancel" should close the modal and return the user to the Create New form. No information should be cleared from the form, and the user should be able to make any desired edits and try again.

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/4+of+7+Check

Messages: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Messages+-+International+Amateur

title: As a Club user I want players contained in my spreadsheet that were not yet added to my Club Reg List to be added
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user is navigate to the spreadsheet upload modal
AND user uploaded the spreadsheet
custom_steps: WHEN the spreadsheet is able to pass the initial required field and format check
custom_expected:
THEN the system will process each of the rows contained in the spreadsheet. 
AND The system will take the information entered in each field, and run a "registration check" according to the standard matching rules to determine if the player already exists in the system as a registered player. 
AND If the player is found to be registered, and the player is not yet on the uploading Org's Club Registration List, then the system will automatically add the player to the uploading Org's Club Reg List. 
OR If more than one matching registration profile is found, all are added to their Club Reg List.
OR If the player is found to be a grandfathered player, no action is taken.
OR If the player is not found in the system, no action is taken.

title: As a Club user I want to be able to download the results of my spreadsheet upload
custom_preconds:
GIVEN a user is logged in with Admin permissions for Registration Profile
AND user is navigate to the spreadsheet upload modal 
AND user uploaded the spreadsheet
custom_steps: WHEN the spreadsheet is able to pass the initial required field and format check
custom_expected:
THEN the system will process each of the rows contained in the spreadsheet. 
AND The system will take the uploaded spreadsheet, add a "Results column" to the end of the spreadsheet, and populate the results for each row contained in the spreadsheet that is processed. 
AND If the player on a row is found in the system and is Registered, the Results column will say Registered.
OR If the player on a row is found in the system and is not Registered, or the uploading Org does not have permission to see the match if it were to be created via the Create New, the Results column will say Not Registered.
OR If the player on a row is NOT found in the system, the Results column will say Not Registered. 
OR If the player entered for a row is not subject to registration based on the DOB entered, the Results column will say Grandfathered. 
AND Once the system has finished constructing this results spreadsheet, it should appear in the Notifications widget of the uploading Club for the uploading user. The Description should read "Club Registration Spreadsheet Upload Results". 
* Clicking on the description of the notification will download the results spreadsheet to the user's computer.

Wireframe: 
https://tb5api.axshare.com/#p=spreadsheet_upload

Template: 
https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/Spreadsheet+Upload+%28Registration%29-+Data+Discovery

title: As a scouting user I want to Submit a new International Amateur profile for review(International Prospects)

**NOTE: The stateflow for international amateurs is different depending on the Scouting Status. This test case refers to the creation of International Prospects, so the Scouting Status MUST be set to that for this flow.**

https://wiki.mlbam.com/display/EBIS/International+Amateur+Player+Profile+-+Data+Discovery
GIVEN a scouting user is logged in with permission to Submit new International Amateur profiles
custom_steps: WHEN scouting user opens a preliminary player profile in view mode
custom_expected:

AND clicking Close should close the profile
BUT when the profile is in Edit Mode, user should have a Save, Submit and Cancel button
AND clicking "Save" should save any edits made to the profile
AND no required field and formatting checks should be run given that the profile is in a Preliminary state
AND the profile's status should not update
AND clicking "Cancel" should ask the user to confirm that they wish to lose any changes
AND if the user confirms, the profile's status should remain preliminary and the profile should reload in view mode
AND clicking "Submit" should run a required field and formatting check per the data discovery
AND once the profile has passed the required field and formatting checks, if the profile was in edit mode, it should be reloaded in view mode
AND the player's status should update to "Submitted"
AND the status should be reflected on the creating scout's Clipboard
AND the player profile should appear for review on the scouting Admin's Clipboard

title: As a Scout Admin I want to Approve a new Trainer/Agent profile
custom_preconds: GIVEN Scouting Admin logs in with scouting and trainer/agent edit permissions
custom_steps: WHEN user is viewing their Admin Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN Scouting admin should see any trainer/agent profile with a Submitted status
AND Opening the submitted trainer/agent profile from the Clipboard should open the item in Edit Mode.
AND There should be Save, Approve, Reject and Cancel buttons available.
AND Clicking "Cancel" will prompt the user to confirm that they wish to lose their changes. If they confirm, the profile is reloaded in view mode and no changes are saved.
AND Clicking "Save" will save any edits made to the profile. All required field and formatting checks should be run given that the profile is in a Submitted state. The profile's status will not update.
AND Clicking "Approve" will save any edits made to the profile. All required field and formatting checks should be run. Once the field checks pass, the form should be reloaded in View Mode, and the profile's status should be updated to "Approved". 
AND The trainer/agent entry should be removed from the Admin Clipboard as well as the submitting Scout's Clipboard.

title: As a Scout Admin I want to be able to approve items from my Clipboard

custom_steps: WHEN scout admin user navigates to Scout Admin Clipboard
custom_expected:
THEN user should be able to check off multiple items and hit "Approve"
AND the system should process them in the order that they were submitted, based on date AND time stamp to ensure proper sequencing
AND this should allow all items to go through, assuming that none of the individual items encounter an issue
AND one item encountering an issue should not prevent other, unassociated items to fail:
 - Ex: If a player profile fails, any player reports that are NOT for that player should still succeed

title: As a Scout I want to submit items from my Clipboard
custom_preconds: GIVEN a scout user is logged in with permissions for Scout Clipboard

custom_expected:
